column1: Two groups of Taiwanese nationals have returned home after being stranded by the coronavirus pandemic in 2 countries. The CECC says some 30 nationals returned from India while 11 Taiwanese came from Saudi Arabia. All will be quarantined and checked for COVID-19 symptoms.

Two groups of #Taiwanese have finally returned home after being stranded by the #coronavirus #pandemic. About 30 people arrived last night via a #SouthKorean flight from #India and #Maldives, while 11 more from #SaudiArabia were brought back through cooperation with #Japan.
Dukes has always been a dirty pit I would avoid. Got some fresh #coronavirus on tap. #COVID19
More than 20000 people still infect coronavirus every day in the U.S.
Coronavirus: Risk in UK lockdown easing too soon, warn scientists
